publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3410 Rob Gibson: Wanderlust for West Highland Line—That the Parliament hails the vote by almost 3,000 readers of Wanderlust, an independent travel magazine, naming the West Highland line as the top rail journey in the world; notes that the West Highland line came ahead of the Trans-Siberian Express and the Cuzco to Machu Picchu line in Peru and beat 400 other nominated rail journeys from around the world, and congratulates ScotRail and all those involved in earning this prestigious recognition for Scotland.

S3M-3410 Wanderlust for West Highland Line (lodged on 9 February 2009) Brian Adam*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Alasdair Allan*, Aileen Campbell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Charlie Gordon*, Michael Matheson*, Jamie McGrigor*, Cathy Peattie*, Mary Scanlon*, Mike Pringle*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Bob Doris*, Robin Harper*, Stuart McMillan*, Sandra White*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3410 Wanderlust for West Highland Line (lodged on 9 February 2009) Jim Tolson*, Alasdair Morgan*, Jamie Hepburn*, Christina McKelvie*
S3M-3410 Wanderlust for West Highland Line (lodged on 9 February 2009) Gil Paterson*

S3M-3410 Rob Gibson: Wanderlust for West Highland Line—That the Parliament hails the vote by almost 3,000 readers of Wanderlust, an independent travel magazine, naming the West Highland line as the top rail journey in the world; notes that the West Highland line came ahead of the Trans-Siberian Express and the Cuzco to Machu Picchu line in Peru and beat 400 other nominated rail journeys from around the world, and congratulates ScotRail and all those involved in earning this prestigious recognition for Scotland. Supported by: Brian Adam, Ms Wendy Alexander, Alasdair Allan, Aileen Campbell, Kenneth Gibson, Charlie Gordon, Michael Matheson, Jamie McGrigor, Cathy Peattie, Mary Scanlon, Mike Pringle, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Bob Doris, Robin Harper, Stuart McMillan, Sandra White, Malcolm Chisholm, Bill Kidd, Jim Tolson, Alasdair Morgan, Jamie Hepburn, Christina McKelvie, Gil Paterson
S3M-3410 Wanderlust for West Highland Line (lodged on 9 February 2009) Joe FitzPatrick*
